short_summary: Stage 1 - East Gate Landslide Check Dams - Glacier National Park
description: Bidders must supply logs and construct check dams. The network of French drains in the landslide area will be installed as well as broadcast seeding of poplar seeds.
duration_in_months: You will have 6 months to complete this project.
full_summary:
**Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) for Stage 1 - East Gate Landslide Check Dams - Glacier National Park**
____________________________________________________________________
## Technical description
Parks Canada is seeking a contractor to supply logs and construct two timber check dams, as well as install a network of French drains in the sub-soil of a slow-moving active landslide adjacent to the Trans-Canada Highway in Glacier National Park. Additional work includes danger tree identification and removal, repair of existing log check dams, and further diversion of water within the landslide catchment. This project aims to promote live silt fencing and mountain alder staking.
## Contract parameters
* Contract value: Between $500,001 and $1,000,000
* Tender closing date: April 3, 2023, 4:00 PM Eastern Time
* Expected contract start date: Not specified
* Expected contract end date: Not specified

## Important notes
* Bidders who consider themselves qualified to provide this work should consult the official solicitation documents available on the Government of Canada's tendering service (www.canadabuys.ca).
* This is a two-stage selection process where only qualified suppliers will be invited to provide a financial bid in Stage 2.
* Any errors due to file size when emailing bids must be resolved by the bidder.
* Bid documents must be sent as attachments, not links, via email to the designated email address.

## Contact information
Carmen Song
Contracting Authority
Parks Canada
Phone: 604-358-9479
Email: [carmen.song@pc.gc.ca](mailto:carmen.song@pc.gc.ca)

## Additional requirements
* Enquiries regarding the ITQ must be submitted in writing and received at least 5 business days prior to the tender closing date.
* Late submissions will not be accepted.
* National Parks Regulations require that all work be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.

## Evaluation criteria
Selection will be based on a two-stage evaluation process, with the first stage focusing on the qualifications of interested suppliers, and the second stage inviting qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid based on specifications and drawings.
